Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is a video game that was released on October 2004. It is the seventh installment in the Grand Theft Auto franchise and is one of the most popular games of all time. The game is an open-world action and adventure game that takes place in the fictional state of San Andreas, which is based on California and Nevada. 

## Gameplay

In Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas, the player takes on the role of Carl "CJ" Johnson, who returns to his hometown of Los Santos after the death of his mother. The game takes the player across different cities and landscapes, allowing them to complete missions and interact with various characters. The gameplay involves driving, shooting, and occasionally using stealth to complete various objectives. 

One of the most unique aspects of the game is the level of customization that is available to the player. They can customize CJ's clothes, hairstyle, and even tattoos. They can also purchase properties and businesses, and invest in stocks to become a millionaire.

## Reception

Since its release, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas has sold more than 27.5 million copies worldwide. The game received critical acclaim for its gameplay, storyline, characters, and open-world design. The game won several awards, including Best PS2 Game and Best Action Game at the 2005 Spike Video Game Awards. 

## Controversy

Despite the game's success, it was not without controversy. The game was criticized for its violence, sexual content, and drug use. In 2005, the game was re-rated from Mature to Adult-Only after a hot coffee mod was discovered that allowed players to access a hidden sex scene. This led to the game being temporarily removed from store shelves. 

## Conclusion

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is a classic video game that has withstood the test of time. It combined a compelling storyline, memorable characters, and an open-world design that allowed players to fully immerse themselves in the game. While it was not immune to controversy, it remains a beloved game that has left a lasting impact on the video game industry.
